Author: emilyrun79
Text: you can tell her exactly that- the things you want to say AND that you are not ready to recover. she isn't going to make you do anything you are not ready to do. she is only there to help guide you to better places that you are willing and ready to go. she won't do anything to you or make you do anything different, but getting that out in the open will be a breath of fresh air. trust me.

Author: Hyde25
Text: It might be worth it to at least mention it to your therapist. My therapist knows I'm not ready to recover, so instead of working towards recovery we work on harm reduction. Her only request is that I'm honest with her, which I am.   I do find it helpful to talk with her about my ED, even if I might never recover. Sometimes its nice to just have someone to talk to without worrying about triggering them or saying the wrong thing.  You could tell your therapist that you're not ready to recover, but you're willing to discuss your ED, and be honest about it with them. I guess it really depends on how comfortable you are with your therapist.
